newsitem.title: JAPAN: ANA falls on Nomura downgrade.
newsitem.headline: ANA falls on Nomura downgrade.

text.p: Shares in All Nippon Airways Co Ltd (ANA) fell on the Tokyo Stock Exchange on Monday morning due to a downgrade by Nomura Research Institute, traders said.
By 0126 GMT, ANA was down 34 yen at 839.
Earlier on Monday, market sources said Nomura Research had downgraded ANA to a "2" rating from its previous "1".

Nomura officials were not immediately available for comment. In its three-grade rating system, the research institute assigns a "2" rating to issues whose values it sees moving within 10 percentage points in either direction of the key 225-share Nikkei average over the next six months.
Japanese business daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported on Sunday that ANA would temporarily suspend a new wage system for its pilots due to opposition from its pilots' union.
The paper said the new system, introduced on April 1, 1996 to cut personnel costs, would be suspended for the fiscal year starting on April 1.
ANA's move could affect the firm's overall restructuring plans, the paper said.
